words.def: an ancient Hebrew unit of dry measure equal to about a bushel
a collection of objects laid on top of each other
any of various primates with short tails or no tail at all
seed of a pea plant used for food
An instance of the interjection ah.
(astronomy) the angular distance of a celestial point measured westward along the celestial equator from the zenith crossing
a very light colorless element that is one of the six inert gasses
an informal term for a father
the 17th letter of the Hebrew alphabet
